comment: Easy class
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: At the beginning of the semester he was a good professor but as time went on he became bad, not grading work, giving complete zeros if you missed one part of an assignment. If you emailed him he never responds, and you don't know your grade in the class which I feel is stupid, literally didn't know my grade until final grades dropped.
he was very nice and tried to make us laugh often, he also was very cooky/weird but in a nice way

Lectures were useless in my opinions (attendance was graded though). We did busy work along working on papers. There are only 3 and he has clear criteria for each and I didnt make below an A on them. VERY difficult to reach out of class. Does not show actual grade throughout semester. Easy A.

Prof. Geoffrey is a ok and average professor. This class is very easy but a waste of time in my opinion. We do not cover much in the lectures and could do everything online at home. We are around 3 weeks till the semester ends and I do not have a single grade in the grade book. Only take him if you want an easy class you learn nothing in.
He is a very good and fun professor. The only thing that is annoying with him is that he does not grade anything, so you never know what you got.

It wasnt necessarily a hard class but the professor doesnt really do much during lectures. Attendance is required but we always got out of class 30 mins early. Dont expect to get grades back, finals are already over and he only put in one grade so youll never know what you have in the class. I would recommend not taking him.
Never replies to emails, gets mad if you question him

He is very weird but a nice guy. The class is easy and you rarely do anything throughout the whole class. The assignments he gives are easy but he hasnt graded anything for us and our class is over. I could have a F right now and have no idea. Take the class if you just want to breeze through it and not learn anything

Professor Adams is great and one of my favorites since attending KSU. Hes very quirky and has a great sense of humor. Youll have 3 main papers with weekly assignments. As long as you do fine on the papers, you can pass no sweat. He grades based on the rubric and can give good feedback. You should take his class, great person and professor!
Dr. Adams is understanding and will help you become a better writer. The papers aren't too difficult so if you can get through those, you can come out of that class with a good grade.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--So many papers

comment: Absolutely loved this professor. He is really great and easy going, your grade is solely based off of three paper grades but they are pretty straightforward and easy. He gives great feedback on all your papers as long as you do the rough drafts. There are in class assignments but I didnt see how they counted towards my grade but they are easy.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He is super nice, but if you're taking him during Covid he is hard to get in contact with. He has misplaced my paper feedback before that was due the next day and I am still waiting on him to grade my essays after the semester is over. I apparently have an A, but I don't know if that's true. He never put in one grade so I never knew my grade.
Great professor overall.

Prof Adams loves English, and he is pretty nice. There were 3 papers, 5 pages each, which you have a lot of freedom, and weekly assignments. He gives good feedback on drafts, but it takes a while. He doesn't grade very strictly. Overall I would say he is a bit above your average professor.

Not a difficult class, just very disorganized. Due to COVID groups met every 3 sessions on a T/Th basis. Due dates on syllabus from spring, feedback took forever & did not provide any insight, info differed by group despite us all being in the same class, answers SOME emails, has you grade papers in class. Overall confusing, but should get an A.

I think overall his class was easy. We have three papers and weekly assignments. We skipped like 4 of those though. He definitely needs to work in answering emails ngl. Just do the work and you cant really fail.
This professor does not answer emails at all and does not use D2l correctly making it very difficult to access assignments and grades. I highly recommend not taking him.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Excellent professor. You will only have three essays for the semester. Gives excellent feedback on the rough draft, so it will be hard to fail the final draft. I would recommend taking him.

He is a nice guy, but would I take him again? Heck no. His assignments include a lot of reading, but not enough time to actually understand the material. His grading criteria is so confusing and he does not go by the syllabus. You will not know your grades until the very last day. His lectures are so long and boring. Avoid him at all cost!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: He is caring and wants you to pass. He assigns three essays, weekly assignments that aren't hard, and attendance is part of your grade. If you need reassurance on a paper, he is VERY accessible outside of the classroom. He responds to emails and will read as many drafts as you want. Take him if you want to ACTUALLY improve your writing skills!!

This was my second class with prof. Adams. He is awesome. We had a total of 3 papers, weekly class work, and a few homework assignments. The third paper was the final. He gives multiple attempts for rough drafts for papers, so you really can't go wrong. I loved his class!

This guy is as basic as one professor can get. He will give you a clear 'grading criteria' and all you have to do is complete his assignments. He does a classroom assignment every day but will have days where he can wander off into a different conversation that can turn into a mini-debate. As long as you go to class and do his work, you'll get an A
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: Your grade is based on three tests and weekly reading responses that are about 500 words in length. He rambles on about things that don't really matter in class. He also isn't very clear on what will be on tests, even though he gives you a study guide.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Awesome teacher!! He takes attendance randomly so its just better to show up, his class was always interesting, and he only has participation grades and 3 papers due during the semester. The last paper is your final! Easy to make an A in the class!
As long as you try on the papers, and you participate in class for daily assignments you will do fine.

Adams was one of my favorites of my first semester in college. He is pretty lenient with assignments. There are 3 papers total (one is the final) and about 10 short assignments that are pass or fail. The papers were all on a topic of your choice, but no grades were put into D2L which was slightly annoying. He's interesting but that made class fun.

He is very funny and understanding. He gave optional days very frequently, especially towards the end. The only grades are the 3 papers and short assignments that are graded by completion. He is a tough grader on papers and never put a grade into d2l. That being said, he was my favorite professor last semester and I would definitely recommend him.

His class was very easy and straight forward however he was very boring and his class wasn't necessary to attend to pass because everything he talk about in class had nothing to do with our assignments. We had reading responses due every Wednesday in class for the weekly readings. But he didn't enter our final exam grade or any of our responses.

He's an amazing professor. I'm taking him for 1101 and it's the easiest class I have. Registering for my spring 2019 classes I revolved my schedule around his 1102 class. This is how much I wanted to take him again. Doing my essays I would literally spend hours having him check my papers in his office hours to get an A and he was happy to do it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: He is a great professor!!! He'll read as many drafts as you send him giving you great feedback to get an A on that paper. There are a few short assignments but they are easy to do!!! He is really fun and sung my class pirate songs on talk like a pirate day during fall semester. He also cancels class a decent amount of times. Take him!!
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great English professor. 3 papers and reading responses that were straightforward. Just put in the effort and its easy enough. Only downside is that attendance was always mandatory but does cancel every once in a while. Pro tip: pick a topic for the papers that is unique, He likes to see that and it can lead to a better grade.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: I am taking him as a Freshman and he's the best. He says class is mandatory but after the first 3 weeks he stops doing roll. Instead he counts your attendance based on who turns in online work. You write 4 papers on whatever you want. And most classes he just gives you easy work to complete. Reading Responses are easy too. He's really funny.

I took this guy for both my English credits. He has 3 papers and then periodic writing assignments but you can write the papers on anything you want. About 1/3 or so classes are optional because of papers. The assignments are passfail. He's easily my favorite teacher I've ever had. You should take this guy

Be read to write, because that is all we did. Every class you will have an assignment which is not hard at all, and you will have until the very end of the day to turn it in. Super easy going guy. He thinks he is funny, which makes him slightly funny, but otherwise you will be bored. No pop quizzed, all grades are from assignments and 4 essays.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS
